title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 24 November 2011 - XWiki
content:
00:08 <jvdrean> has quit  
05:06 <DrLou> has quit  
06:01 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
06:01 <Denis1> has quit  
06:39 <CIA-102> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r29321f5 / (3 files in 3 dirs): [misc] Fixed wrong parents - http://git.io/Xo5uyw  
07:28 <CIA-102> Sergiu Dumitriu xwiki-platform-3.3-milestone-2 \* r998ad59 / pom.xml : [release] Preparing release xwiki-platform-3.3-milestone-2 - http://git.io/YLmTkw  
07:28 <CIA-102> Sergiu Dumitriu xwiki-platform-3.3-milestone-2 \* r477462f / (188 files in 188 dirs): [maven-release-plugin] prepare release xwiki-platform-3.3-milestone-2 - http://git.io/ZRntqg  
07:37 <CIA-102> Sergiu Dumitriu xwiki-enterprise-3.3-milestone-2 \* r7b2996b / pom.xml : [release] Preparing release xwiki-enterprise-3.3-milestone-2 - http://git.io/jI6jmQ  
07:37 <CIA-102> Sergiu Dumitriu xwiki-enterprise-3.3-milestone-2 \* rcdea0f1 / (40 files in 40 dirs): [maven-release-plugin] prepare release xwiki-enterprise-3.3-milestone-2 - http://git.io/epSZBA  
07:41 <CIA-102> Sergiu Dumitriu xwiki-manager-3.3-milestone-2 \* rc2664f9 / pom.xml : [release] Preparing release xwiki-manager-3.3-milestone-2 - http://git.io/7xD5pg  
07:41 <CIA-102> Sergiu Dumitriu xwiki-manager-3.3-milestone-2 \* rc3d0660 / (16 files in 16 dirs): [maven-release-plugin] prepare release xwiki-manager-3.3-milestone-2 - http://git.io/A6Tpyg  
07:43 <tekzilla> has quit  
07:46 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
07:51 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:12 <vmassol> has quit  
08:13 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:25 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:27 <@sdumitriu> Hey vmassol  
08:27 <@sdumitriu> Had some trouble with the release  
08:30 <@sdumitriu> Ping?  
08:59 <vmassol> sdumitriu: yes?  
09:01 <@sdumitriu> There's a cyclic dependency in commons  
09:01 <@sdumitriu> Let me remember what it was  
09:02 <@sdumitriu> xwiki-commons-component-archetype  
09:02 <vmassol> hmm strange  
09:02 <@sdumitriu> The pom inside it depends on some other modules  
09:02 <@sdumitriu> But the release script doesn't notice that  
09:02 <vmassol> since I wiped my local repo and it built fine  
09:03 <vmassol> I'll check  
09:03 <@sdumitriu> So it tries to release it before it builds script nd test  
09:03 <@sdumitriu> Then I had troubles with platform  
09:03 <@sdumitriu> Somehow it didn't resolve correctly all the poms  
09:04 <vmassol> mm there's nothing in component-archetype  
09:04 <vmassol> no dep I mean  
09:04 <@sdumitriu> For some modules, ${commons.version} was resolved as 3.3-SNAPSHOT, and not M2  
09:04 <vmassol> unless you're talking about IT  
09:04 <vmassol> it's very possible IT have a cyclic dep  
09:04 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Right, there are no dependencies declared, but they are used when building  
09:05 <@sdumitriu> So the build order is not computed correctly  
09:05 <vmassol> ok I know what to do  
09:05 <vmassol> I need to expose those deps as test deps  
09:05 <vmassol> on the archetype module itself  
09:05 <@sdumitriu> OK  
09:05 <vmassol> I'll do that now  
09:05 <@sdumitriu> Coming back to the second problem  
09:06 <@sdumitriu> I couldn't find out why the poms weren't resolved correctly  
09:07 <@sdumitriu> Although the parent version was set correctly in the platform root pom, help:effective-pom showed that for some modules the wrong ${commons.version} was retrieved, so somewhere the parent chain was broken  
09:07 <vmassol> I saw you fixed the linkchecker parent poms  
09:07 <vmassol> wasn't that the problem?  
09:08 <@sdumitriu> I don't know  
09:08 <@sdumitriu> It wasn't complaining there  
09:08 <@sdumitriu> I got past the problem by building the whole platform with the correct parent once  
09:08 <@sdumitriu> Then restarting the relese  
09:08 <@sdumitriu> Only then the linkchecker problem was reported  
09:09 <vmassol> so how can I reproduce the issue you had?  
09:09 <@sdumitriu> You could try to reproduce it by checking out 998ad598a1802301462751e39566a7190c822817 and compute the effective pom for all platform modules, starting from the root  
09:09 <vmassol> ok  
09:09 <@sdumitriu> Then check the value for commons.version  
09:09 <@sdumitriu> It should be 3.3-milestone-2 everywhere if everything is correct  
09:10 <@sdumitriu> But I got it wrong on two agent machines  
09:10 <@sdumitriu> It used to work well during milestone-1  
09:10 <@sdumitriu> There's no visible change in the maven modules that could be responsible for this  
09:12 <@sdumitriu> One of the bad modules was xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-observation/xwiki-platform-observation-remote  
09:14 <vmassol> sdumitriu: you haven't put doc for the EM UI in RN  
09:14 <@sdumitriu> Hm... It might have been caused by the bad linkchecker dependencies, since that was also broken, and it could have brought in a wrong xwiki-platform-observation parent somehow, one taken from the local repository instead of the one created by the release plugin  
09:14 <nIMBVS> has joined #xwiki  
09:15 <@sdumitriu> By the way, the actual problem reported was that SNAPSHOT dependencies were detected by the release plugin  
09:15 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:15 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Yes, I was writing them when you showed up  
09:15 <vmassol> ok  
09:15 <vmassol> I saw the tweet and blog post  
09:16 <vmassol> which is why I thought it strange  
09:16 <vmassol> :)  
09:16 <nIMBVS> hi. I'm trying to include a link of the following type in a xwiki document, but xwiki removes the ~ : http://www.example.com/~user  
09:16 <vmassol> sdumitriu: you broke my changes  
09:16 <vmassol> :)  
09:17 <vmassol> there was no lock on the doc so I modified it a few seconds ago (see above)  
09:17 <@sdumitriu> Ah...  
09:17 <@sdumitriu> Sorry  
09:17 <vmassol> I changed only minor stuff  
09:17 <vmassol> let me edit again  
09:17 <@sdumitriu> Didn't I have the lock? Maybe it expired  
09:17 <@sdumitriu> Anyway, the release is not ready yet  
09:17 <vmassol> wdym?  
09:17 <vmassol> I don't understand  
09:17 <vmassol> word is out already  
09:18 <@sdumitriu> Seems that OW2 has a problem with apostrophes, so the package wasn't created correctly by the script  
09:18 <vmassol> "#XWiki Enterprise 3.3 Milestone 2 has been #released! Check it out: http://t.co/7XCFyNn0"  
09:18 <@sdumitriu> I was creating them now  
09:18 <vmassol> k  
09:19 <@sdumitriu> Done with OW2  
09:19 <vmassol> k what's left?  
09:20 <@sdumitriu> Download page  
09:20 <@sdumitriu> Freshmeat and Mail  
09:22 <CIA-102> Vincent Massol master \* racae9dd / (2 files): Improve javadocs - http://git.io/mcYSVA  
09:22 <CIA-102> Vincent Massol master \* r934b336 / xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-component/xwiki-commons-component-archetype/pom.xml : Fix issue where Maven doesn't see that archetype integration tests depend on ...  
09:32 <@sdumitriu> I think that document templates + create form cross-wiki doesn't quite work...  
09:32 <+sburjan> IMHO we should have the downloads in DESC manner. show the latest the first, even if it's not stable or final  
09:40 <@sdumitriu> Ah, and the clirr report which didn't work on the new agent machine, since it's missing xsltproc  
09:41 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Could you try to genereate the clirr report for the release notes, I have to get some sleep  
09:44 <@sdumitriu> Shutting down brain, bye-bye  
09:45 <+Denis> vmassol: I am not sure of the importance, but I experience some sort of regression in XEM when creating and using new wikis  
09:48 <+Denis> the XWikiServer…. page created and the end of the wizard does not display any Last Modified by name, and we currently have a throw from getWikiOwner() sugestting an non-existing wiki :(  
10:00 <+Denis> creator, author and contentAuthor are just empty in the created document  
10:01 <+Denis> s/and the end/at the end/  
10:05 <+Denis> well the throw may be unrelated, but there is at least an issue with the security of the server document, not sure of the impact however  
10:06 <+Denis> mmm  
10:06 <+Denis> but let me check one more think in my setup  
10:16 <+Denis> no, I confirm, there is some regression there  
10:18 <vmassol> Denis: you should create a jirai ssue and mark it for RC1 with a blocker priority  
10:18 <vmassol> and if you could debug it that would be great too :)  
10:20 <+Denis> vmassol: by the way, have you seen my comment on XWIKI-7120 ?  
10:20 <vmassol> yes, seen it  
10:21 <vmassol> Denis: just answered  
10:23 <+Denis> sure it works, but you may have seen it the other way, fixing RightUI to properly expose its livetable, which was the subject of this JIRA  
10:24 <+Denis> and I have little experience on selenium tests, so I wonder why you were doing so complex stuff when this could have been so simple ?  
10:26 <vmassol> well it's thomas  
10:26 <vmassol> not me  
10:27 <vmassol> I don't really know what he was doing  
10:27 <vmassol> what I did before he changed it  
10:27 <vmassol> was to wait for the "loading complete' event sent by the LT  
10:27 <vmassol> but there are issues with this  
10:27 <vmassol> limitations more than issues  
10:28 <vmassol> if you start listenig after the LT has started displaying you may not get the event  
10:28 <vmassol> so you need to refresh the LT in your test  
10:28 <vmassol> to be sure it's going to be sent  
10:33 <+Denis> vmassol: basically, what I was doing is simple, looking if the loading progress bar has disappear, and pooling on that if it is not. Thomas was doing the same, but in place of looking for the bar in the document, he tried to access it using a property of the Livetable object, which require the Livetable object to be globally accessible  
10:37 <vmassol> the only thing I told thomas is that I wasn't 100% sure that if the loading progress bar disappeared meant that all rows were displayed  
10:37 <vmassol> but he checked and said it should be ok  
10:37 <vmassol> so if that works it's fine  
10:37 <vmassol> whether it's access through a js var or through the HTML (if they're set in sync)  
10:52 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:53 <+Denis> vmassol: the UI for extension manager is really broken on my side, is that so bad ?  
10:53 <vmassol> if it's broken yes it's bad  
10:54 <vmassol> it means we need to fix it asap for RC1  
10:54 <+Denis> I could not just seen the second page of the livetables provided  
10:54 <+Denis> anyone reproduce ?  
10:55 <+Denis> sure, it is almost unusable on my side  
10:57 <vmassol> I don't see any livetable  
10:57 <vmassol> where is that?  
10:58 <+Denis> the list of installed or core  
10:58 <+Denis> we are trying to deploy our extension, but is the syntax changed ? we could not found it anymore ?  
10:59 <+Denis> (maven repository based)  
11:02 <vmassol> Denis: I don't see any LT  
11:02 <vmassol> I don't think it's a LT  
11:02 <vmassol> oh maybe it is  
11:02 <vmassol> :)  
11:02 <vmassol> just styled differently  
11:02 <+Denis> do not checked, but it looks like  
11:02 <vmassol> it's displaying fine here on chrome  
11:02 <+Denis> anyway, I cannot navigate in the pages  
11:03 <vmassol> Denis: you should create a jira for it  
11:04 <+Denis> the request parameter are lost in the URL when the firstIndex is changes  
11:04 <vmassol> it would be nice to be able to filter the LT too  
11:04 <+Denis> do you reproduce ?  
11:04 <vmassol> yes I cannot navigate either  
11:04 <+Denis> it seem so poor, that my JIRA could be that it is not working at all !  
11:05 <vmassol> when I click on 2 it goes to: http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?&firstIndex=20  
11:05 <+Denis> right  
11:05 <vmassol> nav is not working  
11:05 <+Denis> can you resolve and install something ?  
11:05 <vmassol> not tried yet  
11:05 <vmassol> going to try to install the python macro  
11:06 <vmassol> should work fine since this is what sergiu used in his tests I belive ;)  
11:06 <+Denis> but what is the syntax ?  
11:06 <vmassol> groupid:artifactid normally  
11:06 <vmassol> no?  
11:07 <vmassol> hmm  
11:07 <vmassol> why does it search?  
11:07 <vmassol> seems installation without searching doesn't exist anymore  
11:07 <vmassol> :(  
11:08 <vmassol> it's completely unusable right now  
11:09 <vmassol> sdumitriu: can you explain how to use it?  
11:09 <vmassol> the doc you've put in RN also doesn't work at all  
11:09 <vmassol> I typed "ruby" and nothing happens  
11:09 <vmassol> (I know why but the doc is misleading)  
11:09 <vmassol> it deosn't say the UI is unusable  
11:09 <vmassol> it's worse than before ATM  
11:10 <vmassol> which isn't too good  
11:10 <vmassol> ....  
11:28 <+Denis> vmassol: how could I install a extension ?  
11:28 <+sburjan> vmassol: sergiu is sleeping  
11:29 <vmassol> Denis: ask sergiu, I have no clue as I said  
11:29 <vmassol> for me it's broken completely  
11:29 <vmassol> see above  
11:29 <+Denis> but you said that you doesn't say it is unusable  
11:30 <vmassol> "it's completely unusable right now"  
11:30 <vmassol> "it's worse than before ATM"  
11:30 <vmassol> isn't that clear enough ? :)  
11:30 <+Denis> ok  
11:30 <vmassol> but don't ask me  
11:30 <vmassol> I'm for nothing on this  
11:31 <vmassol> sergiu coded this  
11:31 <+Denis> by the way, we have used the old one with success :)  
11:31 <vmassol> and committed it  
11:31 <vmassol> and released without anyone having the time to check anything  
11:31 <vmassol> I'm sure sburjan didn't have the time to check it out either  
11:31 <vmassol> Denis: good for the old one, it should only be UI and thus not hard to fix  
11:31 <+Denis> the release was too close, we was using it and have not has the time to see it  
11:32 <vmassol> but the bad thing is that it's now releasedin 3.3M2 and nobody will be able to start using it  
11:32 <+sburjan> no, I didn't test EM. I only reported a small bug on the old interface, not the new one which was committed yestedrday  
11:32 <+sburjan> and search doesn't work on EM because we need  3.3 on xwiki.org.. some REST API's .. not very familiar with  
11:32 <+Denis> vmassol: installing the new one does not destroy the old one  
11:33 <+Denis> you may access it manually at XWiki.ExtensionManager  
11:33 <+sburjan> but vmassol: i tried to install the ircbot app, without success .. on M2 ..  
11:33 <+Denis> but obviously, you need to have an old xar installed before  
11:33 <+sburjan> vmassol: org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-ircbot did not work, maybe I am doing something wrong  
11:34 <vmassol> sburjan: did you report it?  
11:35 <vmassol> it should work fine normally since the ircbot has nothing special  
11:35 <+Denis> sburjan: it does not work, we experience the same, could not add anything with the new UI  
11:35 <vmassol> Denis: he's referring to the old ui  
11:35 <+Denis> oh  
11:37 <+sburjan> no no  
11:37 <+sburjan> I tried this with the new UI, sdumitriu committed yesterday  
11:39 <vmassol> ah ok then nothing works  
11:39 <vmassol> not just ircbot  
11:40 <+sburjan> I'm not very good figuring what I have to write for installing something  
11:40 <vmassol> sburjan: you shouldn't have to figure anything  
11:40 <+sburjan> groupId:artefactId I guess  
11:41 <vmassol> it's a fail if you have to do any thinking  
11:41 <vmassol> s/thinking/guessing  
11:41 <vmassol> and you shouldn't give your go ahead whenever this happens  
11:41 <vmassol> you should put your QA veto  
11:41 <vmassol> :)  
11:41 <+sburjan> then in this case EM is a fail until search will work, because end users don't know much about maven and how to figure out the name of an extension  
11:42 <vmassol> well several points:  
11:42 <vmassol> 1) in teh old ui it's marked exerpimental ie not for everyoe  
11:42 <vmassol> 2) the new ui has removed this which means it's now supposed to be for everyone which is obviously a lie  
11:43 <vmassol> 3) even in experimental mode, if you write that the id you enter is of the format <groupid>:<artifactid> where groupid = … blah blah… and point to the xwiki maven respotiroy  
11:43 <vmassol> in this case it's still usable in experimental mode by advanced users  
11:43 <vmassol> right now it's not even usable by advanced users  
11:43 <vmassol> not even by coders of the xwiki project :)  
11:43 <+sburjan> 1) true, but I was able to install extensions on the old UI. so it was working  
11:44 <vmassol> yes you're proving my point  
11:44 <+sburjan> 2)I agree, it was committed yesterday and didn't get the chance to test it.. and now it's released  
11:44 <+sburjan> 3)I agree with you  
11:44 <+sburjan> so basically EM does not work in 3.3 M2  
11:45 <vmassol> that's my conclusion  
11:45 <+sburjan> mine too  
11:45 <vmassol> Denis just pointed a way around  
11:45 <vmassol> but it's really a workaround and not a solution  
11:45 <vmassol> but we could at least put it in the Release notes  
11:45 <vmassol> I'd like to wait for sergiu to wake up to see if we're missing anything and see what he has to say  
11:46 <+sburjan> well.. I think he'll be on very late in the evening  
11:46 <vmassol> yes it's a pain  
11:46 <vmassol> the time difference  
11:46 <+sburjan> yes ...  
11:47 <+sburjan> anyway, the nuw UI looks pretty nice.. even if it's not working  
11:48 <+sburjan> waiting for the day when search will work, and be able only to write "irc" or "bot" and be able to install it, without maven stuff  
11:48 <vmassol> it's not nice for me  
11:49 <vmassol> it's missing too many features to be nice  
11:49 <vmassol> like filtering  
11:49 <vmassol> going for munch  
11:49 <vmassol> lunch  
11:49 <+sburjan> bon apetit
